com.skoev.timer
Class TimerControl

java.lang.Object
  com.skoev.timer.TimerControl

public class TimerControl
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the application controller; it contains the state of the timer and controls the transition between different states. Used by TimerPanel.

Field Summary
private  int breakTimeLeft
           
private  int breakTimeSet
          Length of the break period.
private  boolean cycleComplete
          Flag set to true when both work time and break time expire.
private  boolean lockOnBreaktime
          If true, lock screen when time for break
private  boolean lockRepeatedly
          If true and lockOnBreaktime is true, keep pressing screen-lock shortcut multiple times (once per second) during break; this prevents user from unlocking screen.
private  boolean loop
          If false, timer stops when both work time and break time expire.
private  boolean nowBreak
          Flag set to true during break.
private  boolean playSoundBreaktime
          If true, sound played when work time elapses and it's time for a break.
private  boolean playSoundWorktime
          If true, sound played when break time elapses and it's time for work.
private  ScreenLocker screenLocker
          Object used to lock screen
private  SoundPlayer soundPlayer
          Object used to play sounds
private  int workTimeLeft
           
private  int workTimeSet
          How long should user work before it is time to take action such as lock screen or play sound

Method Detail

decrementTimer

public boolean decrementTimer()
Decrements timer; this method is called by TimerPanel.timerActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent) every 1000 ms. The action taken depends on the current state of the timer and the control options. It can be to decrement the work time or break time, to reset the time, to lock the screen, and to to play a sound.

Returns:
false if both the work time and break time have elapsed and looping is not turned on, true otherwise
